'4-Nitroaniline', 'p-nitroaniline' or '1-amino-4-nitrobenzene' is an organic
compound with the formula C 6H 6N 2O 2.
It is an organic chemical compound, consisting of a phenyl group attached to an
amino group which is para to a nitro group. This chemical is commonly used as an
intermediate in the synthesis of dyes, antioxidants, pharmaceuticals and
gasoline, in gum inhibitors, poultry medicines, and as a corrosion inhibitor.
